programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker and guests review highlights from Premier League fixtures, including vital games at both ends of the table. Aston Villa hosted Tottenham in a match that could have repercussions for the European places, while other key games saw Newcastle travel to Leeds and Manchester United welcome Wolves to Old Trafford. A sStruggling West Ham crossed to the other side of London to play Brentford, while Nottingham Forest were at Chelsea, and Fulham visited Southampton. The day's other game involved Bournemouth, who were at Selhurst Park to face Roy Hodgson's Crystal Palace.

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures.

programme.title: Politics England
programme.desc: The latest political news, interviews and debate.

programme.title: Animal Park (Love Stories 1) (11/20)
programme.desc: «Love Stories 1»Is rare amur tiger Yana pregnant with the park's first cubs for nearly 20 years?

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S25 (60/80)
programme.desc: Featuring properties in Mablethorpe, Huddersfield and Norwich.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The Bargain Hunt team pay a visit to the Royal Cornwall Showground. Today's show is fronted by Charlie Ross, and lending a hand to the teams are Thomas Forrester and Tim Weeks. Both teams race around the fair hoping to pick up three bargains which they then take to auction. Meanwhile, Charlie visits Smeaton's Tower in Plymouth, a revolutionary lighthouse design at its time and the brainchild of engineer John Smeaton.

programme.title: Points of View
programme.desc: Viewers have their say on the BBC's television shows. Email your thoughts to pov@bbc.co.uk.

programme.title: The Repair Shop S3
programme.desc: The team restore a suspension chair, a damaged deity and a treasured smoker's stand.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Countryfile explores initiatives helping people to improve their mental wellbeing.

programme.title: BAFTA Television Awards
programme.desc: A star-studded audience will be heading to The Royal Festival Hall for the Bafta Television Awards. Teaming up to host the ceremony are comedians and long-time friends Rob Beckett and Romesh Ranganathan. Together, they will celebrate the year's finest TV moments with their sharp wit and unique humour. The ceremony is packed full of show-stopping performances and prestigious awards, but who will be walking away empty-handed, and who will win one of the timeless Bafta masks?

programme.title: Ten Pound Poms S1 (1/6)
programme.desc: The Roberts family leave dreary postwar Manchester for a new life down under.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Mark Chapman introduces highlights from today's two Premier League games, which feature title rivals Arsenal and Manchester City. Pep Guardiola's City travel to face Everton at Goodison Park, where they have won on their past five league visits, including last season when Phil Foden's late goal proved the difference in a thrilling and feisty 1-0 win. Arsenal play host to Brighton, whom they beat 4-2 in an entertaining game on the south coast in December. But the Seagulls were victorious on their most recent trip to the Emirates, a 2-1 win last season. One of Brighton's goals that day came from Leandro Trossard, who is now an Arsenal player.

programme.title: Penalty Takers
programme.desc: Gary Lineker, Alan Shearer and Micah Richards discuss penalty-taking and talk about some of the Premier League stars who have perfected the art of scoring from the spot. Shearer himself is sure to be among the players cropping up in the conversation, along with the likes of Frank Lampard, Steven Gerrard, Harry Kane and Thierry Henry.
